inlineContent.text: Thinking about the way our technology has advanced over time I think it is safe to say that it moves towards smaller and more convenient until that point where smaller is no longer more convenient. A toaster can only get so small before your bread no longer fits. A knife can only get so small before you can’t hold it anymore.
If trying to predict the future of technologies it is a pretty sure bet that they’ll get smaller. The question is what is the usable limit of that piece of technology.

abstract.text: David Brunow, known as Brunow [ˈbɹunoʊ] to the folks he works with, is a human living on Earth. You might have something in common with him — if you think it is ridiculous that he is talking about himself in the first person here, so does he.
